title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.21 - 24 | 10-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: But in the absence of Lord Krishna, all of them at a moment's notice have become null and void.
segments.summary: Arjuna's realization that his powers were dependent on Krishna's presence, illustrated with analogies of clarified butter on ashes, magic wand money, and seeds on barren land.

segments.key_quote: All energies and powers are derived from the Supreme Source, Lord Krishna. And they act as long as He desires. And all of them cease to function as soon as He withdraws.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's explanation that all power comes from Krishna, using the analogy of an electrical powerhouse, and that material advancement without Krishna's blessing is futile.

segments.key_quote: Factually this is all due to the supreme will of the Lord, the personality of Godhead. Sometimes people kill one another, and at other times, they protect one another.
segments.summary: Arjuna recounts the demise of the Yadus due to a brahmana's curse and their intoxication, emphasizing that everything happens according to the supreme will of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: They do not know that behind the law of nature is the supreme direction of the supreme personality of Godhead.
segments.summary: Prabhupada's explanation that the law of nature is directed by Krishna, contrasting it with atheistic views, and emphasizing that peace and prosperity result from following Dharma.

segments.key_quote: The surest way to the path of peace, therefore, is dovetailing everything to the established rule of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by encouraging listeners to embrace Krishna consciousness as the path to peace and prosperity, offering everything to Krishna.
